channel.title: Gaming on Relentless Optimizer
channel.description: Recent content in Gaming on Relentless Optimizer

item.title: On Optimizing QWERTLE
item.description: Last week on Hacker News, someone announced a new Wordle variant, QWERTLE. As an avid Wordle player and optimizer, I was excited to try playing and solving this new game.

item.title: My Best Wordle Guesses
item.description: I’ve seen a lot of “best first Wordle guesses” posts online, but while they may provide the most theoretical information, I had trouble using them as a human.

item.title: Optimizing Kingdom Rush
item.description: I love the tower defense game Kingdom Rush. More than anything else, it has just the right amount of complexity - just enough towers and abilities to give you options, and just enough tactical play to keep you busy between build steps.

item.title: Batman: Arkham Asylum
item.description: The latest in my series of game replays is Batman: Arkham Asylum, thanks to a recent GOG Sale that had it going for $5.

item.title: Quest for Glory I
item.description: Quest for Glory 1 is one of my favorite role-playing games, and one of the first I played. Sierra walked the line between adventure and puzzle games beautifully in the series, making something that still feels unique.

item.title: DOSBox Cheat Sheet
item.description: Some quick tables about DOSBox that I kept looking for. Sound Card Defaults Sound - DOSBoxWiki SoundBlaster 16 Base Address: 220h IRQ: 7 DMA: 1 HDMA: 5

item.title: Win95 on DOSBox
item.description: I needed Windows to run SimTower, so I decided to try getting Win95 to run on DOSBox. The walkthroughs online had some skippable steps and I ran into some problems, and then I got distracted optimizing it.

item.title: SimTower Max Tower
item.description: A few days after my previous SimTower adventure, I wanted to revise my tower design. My retail-heavy-attempt was straightforward and didn’t take too many floors, but I thought it’d be fun to try to build consistently all the way up to the 100th floor cathedral, and to try to max out many of the in-game limits right when I reached it.

item.title: SimTower Reference
item.description: When playing through SimTower again, I was frequently looking for facts from the help and from online walkthroughs. Here’s a double-checked, complete set of the details I was looking for when replaying the game, with more useful details together in one place than the original help.

item.title: Return to SimTower
item.description: It’s 1994, and Maxis is a big name in gaming. The excellent SimCity 2000 released last year, but we’re looking at a lesser known title, SimTower.
